data.title: Whiskey anyone?
data.text: Low profile whiskey bar in the hearth of LoCo, adding to a mix of many other restaurants and bar with more to come surely.

data.title: Big fans of this neighborhood bar
data.text:
Aaron keeps lots of interesting beers on tap here and they frequently rotate.

He also has a very good wine list. 

The tacos are great - especially the ones with kimchee. 

This has become our go-to place to meet friends in downtown Loveland.

data.title: Great stop for a cold brew
data.text: Great stuff if you are looking for beer on tap.  Not as big of a selection as the pour house; but a nice relaxed and laid back place for a beer.  All day, starting at 4pm

data.title: Fun place for apps
data.text: Very cool wooden bar with a lot of character! Fun locals place. We just had apps which were delicious!! Very friendly bartender. Make sure you sign the journal with your name and comments or a picture!   We plan to go back with friends!!

data.title: A great neighborhood hangout
data.text:
While nothing here is mind-blowing, the Laureate is our go to place for drinks with friends in the neighborhood. The staff is always great, the atmosphere is conducive to both large groups (a little noisy) and small intimate gatherings - it's always better on nights without live music (generally too loud for the space). 
The drink menu is extensive and they always have great new beers to try. The back patio is a nice place to be able to step out and get some air with a drink if indoors gets too loud or warm. 
The food tends to be pretty middle of the road - never disappointing, but never good enough to remember what I got last time. We really visit for the company and beverages. :)

data.title: Great Place.
data.text: Aaron is a delightful owner. He has selected some different pub food selections for us to try. Good selection of wines.

data.title: Great gathering place
data.text:
Nice selection and rotation of craft beers

Super friendly staff and nice small plate selections
We always enjoy coming here regardless if it's just us two or a group of 18.

data.title: First visit was so so...
data.text: The menu was pretty limited.  Happy Hour only included one white and one red wine.  The food was fair.  My meatball sandwich was no better than Subway and my wife's mushroom dish was tough.  Our waitress was the only one serving the dining area and bar, so they were understaffed.  She was large, wearing a t-shirt and low jeans, which did not cover her butt crack.  Not too appetizing.  I would recommend Origins, a few doors south.

data.title: MUST try the Thai Basil Daiquiri Martini!  Wonderful downtown addition!
data.text:
We really enjoyed our visit!  We've been wanting to try for sometime and finally visited on Sunday (which, by the way, is "all day happy hour")---how awesome is that?  

Mimosas are included on happy hour all day, as are a selection of a few beers to choose from (delicious, hand-crafted beer I might add).  However, once we reviewed the menu, decided we had to try the Thai Basil Daiquiri Martini.  My husband and I both ordered one (they were that good).  BEST martini I've ever had, and I've had my share across the country as I travel a lot (both personally and for work).  It is 
over-the- top good.  Refreshing, crisp, perfect combination of flavors that work really well together. 

We ordered a few things to try, including the Ginger Slaw, Mashers, and Vegetable Risotto (I am vegetarian).  All perfectly flavored and exceptional pairing with our drinks.  My husband also tried the beef and pork tacos (which he really enjoyed).  Everything was really good.  We did want to order the Chocolate Bread Pudding (to take home with us), but they were out...next time, since we'll be back.  

Loved the ambience, warm, very welcoming.  Seating is somewhat limited, but very comfortable and inviting. 

Service was excellent.

The only comment I'll offer (for the four stars vs. a five) is that the portion sizes are pretty small.  They are priced appropriately, but do except small plates, as they are more a tapas size.  We expected that for the sides we ordered, but not the risotto based on the placement on the menu.  We would suggest asking your server in advance if the size is large enough to share.  Size is perfect for me, but a bit on the smaller size for what my husband would normally enjoy.  

Also, check their calendar. They were hosting a "stout" tasting for a small group the day we were there (which looked super fun)...and something we'll keep an eye out down the road. 

Beer selection is fantastic (draft and bottled w/rotating taps by the appearance of the chalkboard listing specials, et al).   Unique food items made with craft and love.

Fantastic place...we will be back!

data.title: It's pretty good
data.text: Super cute place but the service is mediocre at best.  I have sat with an empty glass any number of times trying to get a staff members attention.  If you can get served, the drinks are good, food is ok but with smallish portions and rather spendy for what you are getting.   I'm glad they are here because it's a comfortable space

data.title: Great addition to downtown Loveland
data.text: A good selection of interesting lighter fare for lunch/dinner, plus a variety of great beers on rotation - local and otherwise - make this a great place to stop in and hang out for a casual outing.

data.title: Great for Beer
data.text: Great beer selection and the small plates are good but limited. The decor is pleasing but sparse. My main gripe is the noise. Loud usually doesn't bother me, but on one visit it was over the top. There simply aren't enough things to absorb the sound waves and too many glass and other hard surfaces. If they invest in some interior modifications to help muffle the sounds, I'll definitely make this a regular watering hole.

data.title: Loud loud loud
data.text: Disappointing evening and service. Atmosphere was so loud we had difficulty hearing our conversation. Evidently the waitress was also having difficulty hearing us order as she didn't write anything down and brought us wrong drinks as well as wrong food the entire time we were there. When we brought this to her attention several times she brought more drinks and after THREE tries the right side dish. When she brought the bill she announced that she was sorry for all the mix-ups and that she had "comp-ed" 3 beers. Not only did she comp only one she charged extra for the side she FINALLY got right. We will NEVER return to this place. There are too many other good choices in the area.

data.title: Nice place to meet friends for a drink after work
data.text: I met a friend here for a drink after work and we each enjoyed our beer and hard cider, as well as sharing an appetizer of different sausages. It wasn't noisy and we had no problem having a conversation.

data.title: Great staff, great beer, and great food!
data.text: There always rotating draft beer selection keeps me coming back for more. The owners and servers are always welcoming and super nice. Love this place!

data.title: Friendly and lively place in Lovelan!
data.text: Have been here three times, and have enjoyed it each time. We sit at the bar, have cocktails, and eat dinner. The menu is limited, but the food is very good. The specials are always interesting. They focus on small plates of interesting things. Prices are fair.  The atmosphere is lively and it is a comfortable space. Try it out!

data.title: Friendly with good beer
data.text: Went here after the funeral of a friend and the atmosphere and server managed to make us all a bit happier. We had a three year old with us and they treated her very well. The menu is a bit limited, but all of the food was great. The only issue we had was the noise level, but we still had a good time.
